title.native: 東京喰種 トーキョーグール

description:
The suspense horror/dark fantasy story is set in Tokyo, which is haunted by mysterious "ghouls" who are devouring humans. People are gripped by the fear of these ghouls whose identities are masked in mystery. An ordinary college student named Kaneki encounters Rize, a girl who is an avid reader like him, at the café he frequents. Little does he realize that his fate will change overnight.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

node.description:
[Main Twitter](https://twitter.com/sotonami) | [Secondary Twitter](https://twitter.com/sotonamix) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCefY-So0u9tiqwCL1Xw3zvA/) | [Tumblr](https://sui-zakki.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/ishida_____sui/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/ishida_sui/) | [Tumblr](https://sui-zakki.tumblr.com/)

Sui Ishida, alternatively known as Sotonami, is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known for his dark fantasy series Tokyo Ghoul, a story about a young man named Ken Kaneki who gets transformed into a ghoul after encountering one. Additionally, he is the character designer and scenario writer for the Switch game Jack Jeanne.
The founder and representative of [Yamato Works](https://anilist.co/studio/7090/).

[Website](https://www.yutakayamada.com/)

Yutaka Yamada is a Los Angeles-based music composer known for his work on the anime television series "Tokyo Ghoul", "VINLAND SAGA" and major Japanese films such as "Death Note:Light Up the New World", "BLEACH" and "KINDGOM". His masterpiece soundtracks for "Tokyo Ghoul" have gained worldwide popularity with related videos totaling over 70 million views on Youtube.

In 2018, Yamada composed for "Cry Me a Sad River", a Chinese film which had succeeded with USD $51Mil. In the same year, Eminem sampled Yamada's master piece "Glassy Sky (from "Tokyo Ghoul")" on his song "Good Guy" in his "Kamikaze" album. 
In 2019, he has worked alongside Sony Pictures for their mega-hit live-action film "KINGDOM" in which he received nomination for the 43rd Japan Academy Film Prize for Best Music Score. WIT Studio, famous for producing "Attack on Titan", released their most anticipated animation series "VINLAND SAGA", with an original soundtrack composed entirely by Yamada. 

Born in 1989, Yamada graduated from Senzoku Gakuen College of Music where he passionately studied musical composition. In 2009, he entered and won the first prize at VIENNA INSTRUMENTS Strings Arrangement Contest.

Today, he is represented by Soundtrack Music Associates, and has since relocated his production base from Tokyo to Sonic Fuel Studios in Los Angeles.

__Birthplace:__ Saitama Prefecture, Japan

Tooru Kitajima, better known as TK, is a singer, songwriter and the lead vocalist and guitarist of the Japanese rock band [Ling Tosite Sigure](http://anilist.co/staff/115154/LingTositeSigure). In 2011, he started to release solo material as "TK from Ling tosite sigure", and started to collaborate with Masayuki Nakano from the former electronic music band [Boom Boom Satellites](https://anilist.co/staff/103901/Boom-Boom-Satellites).
__Mike McFarland__ is an American voice actor, ADR Director, Script, and Line Producer at Funimation Entertainment.

[Twitter](https://x.com/Aaron__Dismuke)

Aaron is an American voice actor who works for anime series of Funimation Entertainment.  He started voice acting when he was nine years old as the voice of Hiro Sohma and the young Akito Sohma in Fruits Basket. He was only twelve years old when he voiced the role of Alphonse Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist, and is a cousin of voice actor and director Justin Cook. Aaron was one of few child voice actors in the voice acting field.  Due to his voice maturing, he was replaced by Maxey Whitehead for his role of Alphonse Elric in Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, but makes a cameo as the voice of the young Van Hohenheim, Edward and Alphonse's father.

[Website](http://themonicarial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rialisms) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rialisms/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaY5WvG6QScTq6dlRbCbp7Q)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer affiliated with Funimation and Seraphim Digital/Sentai Filmworks.

Monica's father is from Pontevedra, Galicia, Spain, and when she was young, her family would often visit there. She would translate for her younger brother some of the European Spanish-dubbed cartoons which included anime like Doraemon and Dragon Ball Z, often imitating the various characters. Monica studied ballet, tap, and jazz, but transitioned to musical theater when was 12. She studied acting through high school as well as college at the University of Houston. She's cited voice actor inspirations from The Simpsons, Family Guy, and Beavis and Butt-head. She was working on a theater show with Jason Douglas, who suggested she audition for ADV Films. Her first voice-over role was a walla in the 1999 dub of Martian Successor Nadesico.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

[Website](http://www.peopleinthebox.com/)

People in the Box is a Japanese post-rock band from Fukuoka formed in 2003. They are signed under Nippon Crown.

Members:
- Hirofumi Hatano (Vocals)
- Kenta Fukui (Bass)
- Shingo Yamaguchi (Drums)
